Weekend Rockville Centre Staircase & Escalator Closure

The escalator and staircase adjacent to the RVC Ticket Office is currently out of service to accommodate a weekend painting project. While the work takes place, customers may use the elevator or alternate staircases at N. Village or N. Park Avenue to get to/from the platform. The project is expected to be completed before the morning rush on Monday, May 1st. Thank you for your patience and understanding while we perform this work.
MARINE PARKWAY AND CROSS BAY BRIDGES - CASHLESS TOLLING

The Marine Parkway and Cross Bay Bridges will change to Cashless Toll collection at 3 AM tomorrow, 4/30/2017. All vehicles should go through the toll plaza without stopping. Please make sure your E-ZPass is mounted to your windshield. To get mounting supplies or to get E-ZPass and save 30% to 50% on MTA tolls, please visit www.ezpassny.com.
Take the LIRR to Belmont Park Spring Meet

The thoroughbreds are off and running and so is LIRR train service to Belmont Park for the Spring Meet now through July 16. Ride the LIRR to Belmont and get $1 off the regular grandstand admission when you show your rail ticket. Purchase LIRR tickets to Belmont Park at staffed LIRR ticket windows, full service ticket machines or through MTA eTix, the LIRR's free mobile ticketing app. Please remember to activate MTA eTix just before boarding your train.

The following planned service change is now ADDED: 11:45 PM Wed to 5 AM Thu, Apr 26 - 27 World Trade Center-bound trains are rerouted via the F from 21 St-Queensbridge to W 4 St Free shuttle buses operate between Court Sq-23 St and 21 St-Queensbridge, stopping at Queens Plaza. To Queens Plaza, transfer to the 7 at Roosevelt Av for service to the nearby Queensboro Plaza station. From Queens Plaza, take the 7 from nearby Queensboro Plaza to Times Sq-42 St and transfer to a downtown A. To/from Court Sq-23 St, use the 7 via transfers at Roosevelt Av or Times Sq-42 St A. To Lexington Av/53 St, use out-of-system transfer between the E at Lexington Av/63 St and the 4 or 6 at 59 St. From this station, take the 7 from nearby Queensboro Plaza to Times Sq-42 St and transfer to a downtown A. To 7 Av, take the E to the nearby 57 St or 47-50 Sts stations instead. From this station, take the D to 59 St-Columbus Circle and transfer to a downtown A. To 5 Av/53 St and E stations along 8 Av, use nearby F stations on 6 Av. From 50 St, 42 St-Port Authority, 34 St-Penn Station, 23 St, and 14 St, take the A instead. This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay. For more information, click on the mta.info link in this email and read station signs.

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

N Line - Weekday and Weekend Planned Service Changes

NIGHTS 11:45 PM to 6:30 AM, Fri to Sun, Apr 14 - 16 11:45 PM Sun to 5 AM Mon, Apr 16 - 17 Manhattan-bound N trains run express from 59 St, Brooklyn to Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr, due to station enhancements. 6:45 AM to 6 PM, Sat and Sun, Apr 15 - 16 Astoria-bound N trains run express from Queensboro Plaza to Astoria Blvd, due to structural improvements. All times until Spring 2017 Astoria-bound N trains skip 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, due to station improvements. N trains stop at Bay Pkwy and 8 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, and Kings Hwy, take the Astoria-bound N to Bay Pkwy and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. To 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, take the Astoria-bound N to 8 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. L Line - Weekend Planned Service Change

Between 8 Av and Lorimer St. 2. Between Broadway Junction and Rockaway Pkwy. Free shuttle buses operate between Lorimer St and Broadway Junction, stopping at Graham Av, Grand St, Montrose Av, Morgan Av, Jefferson St, DeKalb Av, Myrtle-Wyckoff Avs, Halsey St, Wilson Av, and Bushwick Av-Aberdeen St. Transfer between free shuttle buses and trains at Lorimer St and/or Broadway Junction. QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

PM Service Advisory for Wednesday, April 5

As Amtrak crews continue to work at Penn Station to repair track damage caused by an NJ TRANSIT derailment on Monday morning, the Long Island Rail Road plans to operate a reduced PM rush hour schedule, which includes 17 eastbound trains cancelled from Penn Station between 4 p.m. and 8 p.m., and eight others diverted to originate elsewhere. Customers are advised to anticipate delays and to allow for extra travel time. Please visit www.mta.info for updates.

Metro-North's customers of the Port Jervis Line and Pascack Valley Line will have regular train schedules to Hoboken. But Metro-North advises customers that train service from Secaucus will be reduced in accordance with information released by NJ TRANSIT. As a result, Metro-North's Port Jervis Line and Pascack Valley Line who are bound for New York City are advised to remain on their trains until the train reaches Hoboken. There, customers will find continuing service to Manhattan via PATH trains. With extra NJ TRANSIT trains scheduled to enter Hoboken station, Hoboken-bound customers should expect congestion-related delays and plan extra time for travel.

This morning, the Long Island Rail Road will cancel and combine 13 westbound AM Peak trains due to reduced track capacity in Penn Station following Monday's New Jersey Transit derailment. One train will be diverted to Hunterspoint Ave. and one eastbound train to Jamaica will also be canceled. Please allow extra travel time and listen for announcements. For updates, visit www.mta.info/lirr

No Westbound Service From To Penn

Westbound train service from Jamaica to Penn Station is suspended. Westbound train service from Woodside to Penn Station will be suspended from 6 PM to 8 PM. As an alternative for westbound customers, NYC Transit will cross-honor LIRR tickets at Jamaica Station for E train subway service to 34th St/Penn Station and at Woodside for #7 line service to 34th Street. Westbound customers may also take the LIRR to Atlantic Terminal in Brooklyn and transfer there for Manhattan-bound 2/3 line service to 34thSt/Penn Station. NYC Transit will cross-honor LIRR tickets at Atlantic Terminal on the 2/3 subway line for service to Penn Station. NYC Transit will also cross-honor LIRR tickets on the E train for westbound customers at subway stations adjacent to the Kew Gardens and Forest Hills stations.

While Amtrak personnel continue to work to repair tracks damaged in Monday morning's derailment of a NJ Transit train at Penn Station, the Long Island Rail Road needs to cancel 18 trains from Penn Station between 4PM and 8PM, and have 8 others originate at Atlantic Terminal, Brooklyn, or Jamaica, Queens. Normally 87 LIRR trains depart from Penn Station during this time. The cancellations are necessary to allow NJ Transit and Amtrak, which runs Penn Station, the exclusive use of Tracks 13-16, which are normally shared with LIRR; the move means four of the nine Penn Station tracks used by the LIRR for the evening rush hour are not available for use as a result of the derailment. The remaining LIRR trains from Penn Station could experience delays and crowding.

Westbound Service to Penn Will Be Suspended

Westbound train service from Jamaica to Penn Station will be suspended at 4PM. Westbound train service from Woodside to Penn Station will be suspended from 6 PM to 8 PM. As an alternative for westbound customers, NYC Transit will cross-honor LIRR tickets at Jamaica Station for E train subway service to 34th St/Penn Station and at Woodside for #7 line service to 34thStreet. Westbound customers may also take the LIRR to Atlantic Terminal in Brooklyn and transfer there for Manhattan-bound 2/3 line service to 34thSt/Penn Station. NYC Transit will cross-honor LIRR tickets at Atlantic Terminal on the2/3 subway line for service to Penn Station. NYC Transit will also cross-honor LIRR tickets on the E train for westbound customers at subway stations adjacent to the Kew Gardens and Forest Hills stations.

While Amtrak personnel continue to work around-the-clock to repair tracks damaged in Monday morning's derailment of a NJ Transit train at Penn Station, the Long Island Rail Road needs to cancel 18 trains from Penn Station between 4PM and 8PM, and have 8 others originate at Atlantic Terminal, Brooklyn, or Jamaica, Queens. Normally 87 LIRR trains depart from Penn Station during this time. The cancellations are necessary to allow NJ Transit and Amtrak, which runs Penn Station, the use of Tracks 13-16, which are normally shared with LIRR; the move means four of the nine Penn Station tracks used by the LIRR for the evening rush hour are not available for use as a result of the derailment. The remaining LIRR trains from Penn Station could experience delays and crowding.

Metro-North's customers of the Port Jervis Line and Pascack Valley Line will have regular train schedules to Hoboken. But Metro-North advises customers that train service from Secaucus will be reduced in accordance with information released by NJ TRANSIT. As a result, Metro-North's Port Jervis Line and Pascack Valley Line who are bound for New York City are advised to remain on their trains until the train reaches Hoboken. There, customers will find continuing service to Manhattan via PATH trains. With extra NJ TRANSIT trains scheduled to enter Hoboken station tomorrow, Hoboken-bound customers should expect congestion-related delays and plan extra time for travel.

Because of an NJ TRANSIT derailment at Penn Station this morning and continuing track repairs, the Long Island Rail Road needs to cancel 18 trains from Penn Station between 4 p.m. and 8 p.m., and have 8 others originate at Atlantic Terminal, Brooklyn, or Jamaica, Queens. Normally 87 LIRR trains depart from Penn Station during this time. The cancellations are necessary to allow NJ TRANSIT and Amtrak, which runs Penn Station, the exclusive use of Tracks 13-16, which are normally shared with LIRR; the move means four of the nine Penn Station tracks used by the LIRR for the evening rush hour are not available for use as a result of the derailment. The remaining LIRR trains from Penn Station could experience delays and crowding.

Westbound train service from Jamaica to Penn Station will be temporarily suspended at about 4 PM. Westbound train service from Woodside to Penn Station will be suspended from 6 PM to 8 PM. As an alternative for westbound customers, NYC Transit will cross-honor LIRR tickets at Jamaica Station for E train subway service to 34th St/Penn Station and at Woodside for #7 line service to 34th Street. Westbound customers may also take the LIRR to Atlantic Terminal in Brooklyn and transfer there for Manhattan-bound 2/3 line service to 34thSt/Penn Station. NYC Transit will cross-honor LIRR tickets at Atlantic Terminal on the 2/3 subway line for service to Penn Station. NYC Transit will also cross-honor LIRR tickets on the E train for westbound customers at subway stations adjacent to the Kew Gardens and Forest Hills stations.
Impact of NJT Derailment on Eastbound LIRR Service

Due to an earlier New Jersey Transit derailment, the LIRR anticipates cancellations and delays from Penn Station during this evening's rush hour. Customers are advised to allow extra travel time. Although the LIRR was able to operate normally during the off-peak hours, four of the nine Penn Station tracks used by the LIRR for the evening rush hour are currently not available for our use as a result of the derailment. With only Tracks 17-21 available to the LIRR, our service capacity from Penn is reduced by almost 50% during tonight's PM Peak. The LIRR will provide normal PM peak service from Atlantic Terminal in Brooklyn and Hunterspoint Avenue. Trains from those terminals normally have some available seating capacity.

Danbury Branch Substitue Busing, Friday March 31 - Sunday, April 2

Substitute weekend bus service will be provided between Danbury and South Norwalk stations for select trains from Friday through Sunday March 31 - April 2 to allow for infrastructure improvements. Buses will operate approximately 15 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination before boarding.
